content: Frank Wang - School of Computing - University of Kent Jump to content design1 Professor Frank Zhigang Wang Professor in Future Computing Email f.z.wang@kent.ac.uk Telephone +44 (0)1634 20 2988 More information ORCID iD: 0000-0003-4378-2172 Location Room G18 Kennedy Building University of Kent Canterbury Kent CT2 7FS Research website Professor Frank Zhigang Wang On this page About Research interests Teaching Supervision Professional About Five years after earning his PhD in the UK, Frank achieved a promotion to a full professorship at the Cambridge Cranfield High Performance Computing Facility. Six years later, he took the role of Head of the School of Computing at the University of Kent.To date, Frank has successfully secured research grants totaling £5 million from the EC/UK/industries. He has also chaired or co-chaired more than 10 international conferences, such as the ACM Conference on Information and Education Innovations (Manchester), International Conference on Computing Informatics and Networks (Delhi), International Collegiate Competition for Brain-Inspired Computing (Beijing), International Conference on Frontiers and Advances in Analytics and Data Science (Xi’an), International Conference on Next Generation Mobile Apps, Services, and Technologies (Oxford), International Conference on Cloud and Service Computing (Shanghai), IEEE International Conference on Computational Science and Engineering (São Paulo), IEEE Conference on Networking, Architecture, and Storage (Guilin), and IEEE Conference on Scalable Information Systems (Hong Kong).Frank has served as a panel member for the UK government EPSRC "ICT," "e-Science," and "Hardware for Efficient Computing" programs. He is a Fellow of the British Computer Society (BCS) and held the position of Region 8 Area 2 Coordinator for the IEEE Computer Society, overseeing more than 10 Western European countries, including the UK, Ireland, France, Germany, Netherlands, Iceland, Denmark, Austria, Luxembourg, Switzerland, Belgium, Spain, and Portugal. He served as the Chairman of the UK and Ireland Chapter, IEEE Computer Society.
